intro: Hieracium aymericianum subsp. gavarniense, commonly known as the Gavarni hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bract-like structures around its flower heads. This subspecies is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its specific ecological requirements.
